results.title: Colloids (elementary principles)
results.creator_credit: ERPI Classroom Films and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Among the examples of colloidal suspension studied in this film are: fog (liquid in gas); whipped cream (gas in liquid); clay and india ink (solid in liquid); smoke (solid in gas); and mayonaise (liquid in liquid). Failure to settle is explained by Brownian movement, protective films, and charges on particles. The Cottrell process of smoke precipitation concludes the film.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ERPI Classroom Films and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films

results.title: Colloids
results.brief_description: A description of the properties of colloidal suspensions, concentrating on the means of preventing coagulation by attraction between particles. Examples are taken from everyday occurrence including the activity of detergents on oils.
results.description: A description of the properties of colloidal suspensions, concentrating on the means of preventing coagulation by attraction between particles. Examples are taken from everyday occurrence including the activity of detergents on oils.

results.title: Colloids
results.creator_credit: Cammell Hudson Productions and Piers Jessop
results.brief_description: An explanation of the behaviour of particles suspended in a medium of which commonplace examples are milk, clouds and stained glass. Describes the factors involved in colloid formation. Discusses the importance of colloid chemistry to industry, the understanding of which is an essential part of today’s technology.

results.title: Collins Street Walk
results.creator_credit: Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School, Tony Evans and Paul Connor
results.brief_description: Children from Fitzroy Primary School are shown on the National Trust’s Collins Street Walk. They then use the graphics facility at Swinburne Institute’s computer installation to create an animated film based on the experience. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: Collingwood
results.brief_description: A historical look at Collingwood which shows and discusses early settlement, farming, brewing, some manufacturing and retail activities. Includes two interviews - one with a former factory worker and one with a shoe factory worker.
results.description: A historical look at Collingwood which shows and discusses early settlement, farming, brewing, some manufacturing and retail activities. Includes two interviews - one with a former factory worker and one with a shoe factory worker.

results.title: Collide
results.brief_description:
Collide is an interactive artwork comprising 9 images. It was born from a wish to make the viewing of the images a kind of journey- where the movement of the eye and the cursor make a path, mouse clicks causing progression along that path.

Using the metaphor of journey making the artist found a way to allow a progression from image to image by way of using a hotspot

results.title: Colleges of Advanced Education
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Malcolm Smith and John Martin-Jones
results.brief_description: Colleges of Advanced Education offer a practical alternative to University training in a number of technical and creative fields. This film examines the wide range of studies being undertaken in Colleges of Advanced Education, all over Australia.

results.title: College
results.creator_credit: Buster Keaton Productions, Joseph Schenck, Buster Keaton and James W. Horne
results.brief_description: Buster goes to college and becomes sports obsessed when his lady love considers him less than manly. Spending a fortune on every imaginable piece of sporting apparatus, Buster is determined to muscle his way into her affections. This film is representative of Keatons madcap antics and incredible stunts with a grand comic finale which will leave the audience reeling.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Buster Keaton Productions, Joseph Schenck, Buster Keaton and James W. Horne

results.title: Collectors
results.brief_description: An inventive and funny documentary that looks at various types of collections. Reg collects spark plugs and Margot collects frogs. Even more interesting are the collectors. There is a thriving sub-culture of ‘object hunters’ out there, attending swap meets and fetes in search of that ‘ gem ‘. Some say it’s all in the chase while others prefer the find!

results.title: Collectors
results.creator_credit: Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School, Luigi Acquisto, Chris McGill and Diana Leach
results.brief_description: An inventive and funny documentary that looks at various types of collections: snow domes, frogs, spark plugs, etc. Even more interesting are the collectors themselves who are forever in search of that ‘gem’.
